intro: Anthyllis vulneraria f. font-queri, commonly known as the Font-Queri's burnet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces trifoliate leaves with a hairy surface, and its root system is typically fibrous. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils, often in temperate regions. This subspecies is distinguished by its specific floral morphology and geographic distribution.
